page.title: 09Farming Sandon Hall Farm
page.content: {Sandon Hall}farm is a mixed farm of 410 acres valued at about Â£750,000, owned by{Mr.Barr.}His grandfather started the farm in the 1920's but there has been a house built on the site since the 13th century.{Mr. Barr has 3 people to help him on the farm. There are 333 sheep which are sheared in December and then kept inside until they lamb in March. 22 cows are kept for calving, not for milk, and there are also a few beef animals.The farm keeps 10 laying hens for eggs for themselves, 2 horses for pleasure, 2 sheepdogs to help with the sheep, some ducks for eggs, and one dog and two cats for pets. The farm is divided into about 30 fields and{Mr.Barr}has 4 tractors and a combine harvester which he uses to work the land.In the near future 9 acres will be lost by the farm when the new by_pass is built.
